title: HyPrSpace Fires Up Terminator Stage Demonstrator
summary: French rocket builder HyPrSpace has completed the first successful hot fire test of its Terminator stage demonstrator. HyPrSpace is developing a small rocket called the Orbital Baguette One (OB-1), which will be powered by hybrid rocket engines. The company’s hybrid rocket technology has been developed with support from the French General Directorate of Armament (DGA) […]

title: KBR to acquire defense and space contractor LinQuest for $737 million
summary: The acquisition would increase KBR's access to military customers such as the U.S. Space Force

title: Rebekah Hounsell: Tracking Cosmic Light to Untangle the Universe’s Darkest Mysteries
summary: Rebekah Hounsell is an assistant research scientist working on ways to optimize and build infrastructure for future observations made by the Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope. The mission will shed light on many astrophysics topics, like dark energy, which are currently shrouded in mystery. Rebekah also works as a support scientist for the TESS (Transiting […]

title: 55 Years Ago: Apollo 11’s One Small Step, One Giant Leap
summary: “Houston, Tranquility Base here, the Eagle has landed.” “That’s one small step for [a] man, one giant leap for mankind.” “Magnificent desolation.” Three phrases that recall humanity’s first landing on and exploration of the lunar surface. In July 1969, Apollo 11 astronauts Neil A. Armstrong, Michael Collins, and Edwin E. “Buzz” Aldrin completed humanity’s first […]

title: NASA Signs US, Saudi Arabia Agreement for Civil Aeronautics, Space Collaboration
summary: The United States and Saudi Arabia signed a framework agreement that opens new possibilities for cooperation with NASA in areas such as space science, exploration, aeronautics, space operations, education, and Earth science. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson signed on behalf of the U.S., and CEO of the Saudi Space Agency Mohammed bin Saud Al-Tamimi signed on […]

title: Refuellable satellites offer critical edge amidst intensifying threats in space
summary: With technical challenges solved, now is the time to invest in refuellable spacecraft, writes Orbit Fab's executive team.

title: The legacy of Apollo 11, 55 years later
summary: A reflection on Apollo 11, on the 55th anniversary of its launch in 1969, and lessons learned for today's space explorers.

title: Up close and personal: Ariane 6 liftoff from the launchpad
summary: While no person could get this close during Ariane 6’s inaugural flight on 9 July 2024, several small cameras bravely witnessed its take-off from the launchpad.

title: Introducing Ramses, ESA’s mission to asteroid Apophis
summary: 30 years ago, on 16 July 1994, astronomers watched in awe as the first of many pieces of the Shoemaker-Levy 9 comet slammed into Jupiter with incredible force. The event sparked intense interest in the field of planetary defence as people asked: “Could we do anything to prevent this happening to Earth?”

title: ESA Announces Ramses Mission to Study Asteroid’s Close Flyby of Earth
summary: The European Space Agency (ESA) has announced the commencement of preparatory work on Ramses, the agency’s planetary defence mission. The Rapid Apophis Mission for Space Safety (Ramses) is the latest mission of ESA’s Space Safety programme, which was created in 2019 to mitigate natural and human-made threats to critical European infrastructure and, more broadly, life […]
